LongDescription: When piloting a vehicle using the Piloting (Planetary) skill, the character does not suffer the penalties for driving through difficult terrain.
Brawl and Ranged (Light) become career skills.

When required to make a Knowledge skill check, the character can instead make a Bought Info action. He spends a number of credits equal to 50 times the difficulty of the check and counts as succeeding on the check with one uncanceled :suc:. At the GM's discretion, the character may not be able to use this ability if the information sought is particularly hard to find, or if the character is in a situation where he could not purchase information (such as marooned on a planet with no access to the HoloNet).

Description: Once per session, may introduce a "fact" into the narrative as if a Destiny Point had been spent.
LongDescription: Once per game session, the character can choose to introduce a "fact" or additional context directly into the narrative as if he had spent a Destiny Point.

Description: Once per session, make one skill check using Cunning rather than the charactaristic linked to that skill.
LongDescription: Once per game session, the character can choose to make one skill check using Cunning, rather than the characteristic linked to that skill. When he does this, he must explain how, in this particular instance, his cunning is helping him overcome this challenge.

Description: Remove :bk: per rank of Commanding Presence from Leadership and Cool checks.
LongDescription: The character removes :bk: per rank of Commanding Presence from his Leadership and Cool checks.

Description: Take the Coordinated Assault maneuver: a number of engaged allies equal to Leadership ranks add :adv: to combat checks until beginning of next turn. Range increases per rank of Coordinated Assault.
LongDescription: The character may make a Coordinated Assault maneuver. If he does so, a number of allies engaged with him equal to his ranks in Leadership gain :adv: on combat checks they make until the beginning of the character's next turn. The range of this maneuver increases by one band per rank of Coordinated Assault.
The character reduces the critical rating of all improvised weapons he is wielding by 2 (to a minimum of 1).

Upon making a successful attack with a starship or vehicle weapon, may spend :adv: :adv: to reduce the maximum speed of the target by 1 (to a minimum of 1) until the end of the next round. If the starship or vehicle was traveling its maximum speed, it has its current speed reduced to the new maximum.

When making a ranged attack while engaged with an opponent, the character may suffer 2 strain to reduce the ranged modifier added for being engaged by 1 for the attack. So, when firing a Ranged (Heavy) weapon, the character only increases the difficulty by 1 when engaged, and when firing a Ranged (Light) weapon, he doesn't increase the difficulty at all.
Before attacking a starship or vehicle, the character may spend 1 Destiny Point to ignore the effects of the Massive rule for the attack.

When in a starship or vehicle, the character can make a Fire Control maneuver. If he does so, all combat checks from the starship or vehicle count the silhouette of the target as one higher than normal until the beginning of the character's next turn. This effect does not stack with multiple uses of the Fire Control maneuver.

Once per game session, the character can choose to make one skill check using Willpower, rather than the characteristic linked to that skill. When he does this, he must explain how, in this particular instance, his willpower is helping him overcome this challenge.

When the character performs the Gain the Advantage action (see page 247), a number of allied vehicles equal to his ranks in Leadership and within close range also gain the benefits of the action on the target. These allied vehicles maintain the benefits until they leave close range with the character or the character loses the benefits of Gain the Advantage.

When piloting a ship or vehicle, the character may take the Full Stop maneuver to immediately reduce the speed of the ship or vehicle to zero. The ship or vehicle then suffers one point of system strain for every point of speed it had before stopping.

Before making a social interaction check, the character may perform a Greased Palms maneuver and spend up to 50 credits per rank of Greased palms. For every 50 credits spent, the character upgrades the ability of the skill check once. How the money accomplishes this can be up to the player and GM, but could take the form of bribes, buying gifts, or even purchasing information that gives the character an advantage in the ensuing interaction

Once per game session, the character can take an Incite Rebellion action to make a Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) Coercion check. If successful, a number of beings up to his ranks in Coercion become unhappy and try to take action against an organization or authority with power over them until the end of the encounter. This could be due to something the character did or said, or just because the beings were already unhappy with their position.

Once per encounter, when an ally within short range attempts a skill check using the Brawn or Agility characteristic, the character may roll :wh:. Each :lsp: adds :suc: to the target's check; however, each :dsp: adds :thr: to the target's check.

Once per game session, when an ally is about to suffer a critical injury, the character can take an It's Not That Bad incidental to make a Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) Medicine check. If successful, the ally does not gain the Critical Injury and does not suffer any of its normal effects (although the attack that caused the Critical Injury still deals its damage as normal).
Once per round when piloting a vehicle using the Piloting (Planetary) skill, the character may voluntarily suffer two strain to perform any action as a maneuver instead.
The character decreases the :adv: cost to activate the Blast quality on any weapon he uses by 1 to a minimum of 1. This includes the cost to activate the Blast quality if the weapon misses.
Once per round, the character may suffer two strain to decrease the difficulty of his next Leadership check by one, to a minimum of Easy (:pu:).
Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Piloting (Planetary) or Gunnery check.

Description: Once per session. may reroll any 1 Cool or Leadership check.
LongDescription: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Cool or Leadership check.

Upon making an unsuccessful attack with a starship or vehicle weapon, the character may spend :adv: :adv: per rank of Overwhelm Defenses. Reduce the defense rating in the defense zone targeted by the attack for the remainder of the encounter by 1 for every :adv: :adv: spent.
The character adds :bl: per rank of Physical Training to his Athletics and Resilience checks.
The character increases the Blast quality damage dealt by explosives, explosive weapons, and grenades he uses by 1 per rank of Powerful Blast.

Once per game session, the character can choose to make one skill check using Agility, rather than the characteristic linked to that skill. When he does this, he must explain how, in this particular instance, his agility is helping him overcome this challenge.

When using weapons with the Blast quality or explosive devices, the character may spend :adv: to exclude one target that would normally be affected by the explosion. Multiple targets may be excluded in this manner, but the total number may not exceed his ranks in Selective Detonation. The character may also spend :tri: to exclude multiple targets, as long as the total number of targets excluded does not exceed his ranks in Selective Detonation.

When in a starship or vehicle with functional corns, allies within short range add :bl: to their Perception and Vigilance checks. Allies within close range add :bl: :bl: instead. This talent operates on planetary scale, not personal scale.
The character adds :bl: per rank of Sleight of Mind to his Stealth checks unless the being attempting to detect the character is immune to Force Powers.

At the beginning of each game session, the character gains credits equal to his ranks in Sound Investments times 100. How this money is earned is up to the player and CM, and could be actual investments, business dealings, or even a small legal or illegal side business. The GM can also decide that the current events of the adventure may make these funds temporarily unavailable.

Description: Slimpacks heal 1 addilional wound per rank of Stimpack Specialization.
LongDescription: Whenever the character uses a stimpack, the target heals an additional wound per rank of Stimpack Specialization. The sixth stimpack and beyond each day still have no effect.
Characters with the Strong Arm talent treat thrown weapons as if they had one step greater range, to a maximum of medium range.
Melee and Ranged (Heavy) become career skills.

The character may spend 1 Destiny Point to perform a Move maneuver as an incidental to attempt to move into cover or out of the blast range of a weapon or explosion. This may be performed out of turn. This incidental occurs after the character determines he would be hit by the blast, but before damage is applied.

When activating Time to Co, the character may allow one ally he is engaged with to also perform an out of turn Move maneuver as an incidental to attempt to move into cover or out of the blast range of a weapon or explosion. This incidental occurs after the ally determines he would be hit by the blast, but before damage is applied.

Once per round, before the character makes a ranged attack, he may perform a True Aim maneuver. By performing this maneuver, the character gains all the benefits for aiming and also upgrades his attack roll once per rank of True Aim.
If the percentile roll made when the character receives a Critical Injury is 1 or is reduced to 1, the character does not receive the Critical Injury and suffers none of the effects.
Gunnery and Piloting (Planetary) become career skills.
Knowledge (Core Worlds) and Knowledge (Outer Rim) become career skills.

Once per game session, the character can choose to make one skill check using Presence, rather than the characteristic linked to that skill. When he does this, he must explain how, in this particular instance, his social ability is helping him overcome this challenge.
Upgrade the difficulty of any combat check targeting this character once per rank of Adversary.

Description: After making a successful attack, may spend 1 Destiny Point to add damage equal to Intellect to one hit.
LongDescription: After a successful attack with a non-starship/vehicle weapon, the character may spend one Destiny Point to add damage equal to his Intellect to one hit of the attack.

Description: When wearing armor, increase total soak value by 1.
LongDescription: When wearing armor, the character increases his total soak value by one.

Description: When wearing armor with a soak value of 2 or higher, increase defense by 1.
LongDescription: When wearing armor with a soak value of two or higher, the character increases his defense by one.

Patients under the character's supervision regain one additional wound per rank of Bacta Specialist each time they recover a wound while recovering in a Bacta tank or under supervised medical conditions or long-term care.

Once per game session, the character may take a Bad Motivator action to make a Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) Mechanics check. If successful, one device (subject to the GM's approval) spontaneously fails due to the character's involvement, or because it was about to fail anyway and the character noticed it (this is the character's decision).

Description: When the character recovers strain at the end of the encounter, he may add :wh: per Force rating. He recovers additional strain equal to :ldsp: generated.
LongDescription: Add one damage per rank of Barrage to one hit of successful Ranged (Heavy) or Gunnery attacks with nonstarship/vehicle weapons at long or extreme range.

When looking to purchase illegal, exotic, or black market goods, the character may decrease an item's rarity by one level per rank in Black Market Contacts. For each level an item's rarity is decreased, its cost increases by 50% of its base cost.
When the character recovers from strain at the end of each encounter, he may roll his Force rating in Force dice. He regains additional strain equal to the :lsp: rolled.

Add :bl: per rank of Blooded to all checks to resist or recover from the effects of poisons, venoms, and other toxins. Reduce the duration of any related ongoing effects or damage from toxins, venoms, or poisons by one round per rank of Blooded to a minimum of one.

Description: Once per round, perform the Body Guard maneuver to guard an engaged character. Suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks of Body Guard. then until the beginning of the next turn upgrade the difficulty of combat checks targeting the character by that number.
LongDescription: Once per round on the character's turn, the character may perform a Body Guard maneuver to protect one ally he is engaged with. He then suffers a number of strain no greater than his ranks in Body Guard. Until the start of the character's next turn, upgrade the difficulty of all combat checks targeting the protected ally a number of times equal to the strain suffered by the character.

Description: Perform the Brace maneuver to remove :bk: per rank of Brace from the next Action. This may only remove :bk: added by environmental circumstances.
LongDescription: As a maneuver, the character may Brace himself. This allows a character to remove :bk: per rank of Brace from the next skill check based on changing conditions, inclement weather, unstable surfaces, zero gravity, heavy gravity, or other disruptive physical obstacles that would make a skill check more difficult.

The character may make the Brilliant Evasion action when piloting a vehicle or starship. The character selects one opponent and makes an Opposed Piloting (Planetary or Space) check If he succeeds, the opponent's vehicle or starship cannot make any attacks against the character's vehicle for a number of rounds equal to the character's Agility. Brilliant Evasion can only be performed once per encounter.
Remove :bk: equal to the character's ranks in Bypass Security from Skullduggery or Computers skill checks made to disable a security device or open a locked door.

The character removes :bk: from any attempt to break codes or decrypt communications equal to his ranks in Codebreaker. In addition, the character decreases the difficulty of Computers or Intellect checks made to break codes or decrypt communications by one. This does not increase with additional ranks of Codebreaker.

Description: Add :bl: per rank of Command when making Leadership checks. Affected targets add :bl: to Discipline checks for next 24 hours.
LongDescription: Gain :bl: when making Leadership checks (or other checks to inspire, lead, or rally an audience) per rank of Command. Inspired targets also add :bl: per rank to any subsequent Discipline checks they make over the next twenty-four hours. This does not increase with additional ranks of Command.

Description: May decrease difficulty of Deiscipline checks to avoid fear by 1 per rank of Confidence
LongDescription: The character may decrease the difficulty of any Discipline check to avoid the effects of fear by one level per rank of Confidence. If he decreases the difficulty to zero, he does not have to make a Discipline check.

Once per game session, the character can take a Contraption action. With a successful Hard(:pu: :pu: :pu:) Mechanics check, the character can fashion a device to solve a current problem using the tools and parts on hand. This device must be approved by the GM and functions for the duration of the current encounter only. Those tools are destroyed in the process. :tri: may be spent to allow the tools to be recovered to be reused later.
Remove :bk: per rank of Convincing Demeanor from any Deception or Skullduggery check.

Description: Increase the difficulty of next combat check by 1. If check deals damage, target suffers 1 strain whenever he moves for the remainder of the encounter.
LongDescription: The character may voluntarily increase the difficulty of a combat check by one to deal a crippling blow. If he succeeds and deals damage to the target's wound threshold, the target suffers one strain whenever he moves for the remainder of the encounter.
The character may spend one Destiny Point to add additional damage equal to half his Agility rating (rounded up) to one hit of a successful attack made by ship or vehicle-mounted weaponry.

The character may spend one Destiny Point to add additional damage equal to his Agility rating to one hit of a successful attack made by ship or vehicle mounted weaponry. This replaces the normal ability for Dead to Rights.

Description: When acquired, choose 1 combat skill. Add damage equal to ranks in that skill to one hit of successful attack made using that skill.
LongDescription: Each time the character gains a rank of Deadly Accuracy, he must choose one combat skill. The character may add his basic training ranks in that combat skill as additional damage to one hit of a successful attack made with that skill with non-starship/vehicle weapons. He cannot choose the same combat skill twice.

Description: Gain +1 to a single characteristic. This cannot bring a characteristic above 6.
LongDescription: Each rank permanently increases a single characteristic of the player's choice by one point. This cannot bring a characteristic above six.
Any vehicle the character pilots has its defense rating on all zones increased by one per rank of Defensive Driving.

When attempting to defend a computer system against intrusion (or when an opponent attempts to slice a computer I owned or programmed by the character), the character adds :bk: equal to his rank of Defensive Slicing to his opponent's checks

When attempting to defend a computer system against intrusion, the character upgrades the difficulty of an opponent's dice pool a number of times equal to his rank of Defensive Slicing. This replaces the usual benefits from Defensive Slicing.

Description: Once per round, may perform Defensive Stance maneuver and suffer a number of strain to upgrade difficulty of all incoming melee attacks by an equal number. Strain suffered this way cannot exceed ranks in Defensive Stance.
LongDescription: One per round on the character's turn, the character may perform a Defensive Stance maneuver to assume a defensive stance against incoming melee attacks. He then suffers a number of strain no greater than his ranks in Defensive Stance. Until the start of the character's next turn, upgrade the difficulty of all melee combat checks targeting the character a number of times equal to the strain suffered by the character in this way.

Description: After hitting with combat check, may spend :adv: :adv: to disorient target for number of rounds equal to ranks in disorient.
LongDescription: After hitting with a combat check, the character may spend :adv: :adv: to disorient his foe (see page 218). Disoriented targets add :bk: to all skill checks. The target is disoriented for a number of rounds equal to the attacker's ranks in Disorient.

Description: When targeted by a combat check, may perform a dodge incidental to suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks of Dogde, then upgrade the difficulty of the check by that number.
LongDescription: When targeted by a combat check (ranged or melee) the character may choose to immediately perform a Dodge incidental to suffer a number of strain, then upgrade the difficulty of the combat check by that number. The number of strain suffered cannot exceed his ranks in Dodge.
The character may reduce a Critical Injury result he suffers by 10 per rank of Durable, to a minimum of one.
Character gains + 1 soak value per rank of Enduring

Description: Remove :bk: per rank of Expert Tracker from checks to find tracks or track targets. Decrease time to track a target by half.
LongDescription: Remove :bk: per rank of Expert Tracker from checks to find or follow tracks. Survival checks made to track targets take 50% less time than normal. This does not decrease with additional ranks of Expert Tracker.

Once per game session the character may spend a maneuver to make a Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) Knowledge (Outer Rim) or Knowledge (Core Worlds) check. If successful, the character is familiar with the type of planetary environment he finds himself in. He knows whether the planet is likely to be inhabited and, if so, where habitation could be found. He also knows about unusual environmental effects, hostile predators, or sources of potential profit.
The character deals + 1 damage to one hit on all successful Brawl and Melee checks per rank of Feral Strength.

Description: Take the Field Commander action: make an Average (:pu: :pu:) Leadership check. A number of allies equal to Presence may immediately suffer 1 strain to perform 1 free maneuver.
LongDescription:
The character may take a Field Commander action.
By successfully passing an Average (:pu: :pu:) Leadership check, a number of allies equal to his Presence may immediately suffer one strain to perform one maneuver. This does not count against the number of maneuvers they may perform in their turn. If there are any questions as to the order in which allies act, the character using Field Commander is the final arbitrator

Description: Field Commander action affects allies equal to double Presence, and may spend :tri: to allow allies to suffer 1 strain and perform 1 free action instead.
LongDescription: When taking a Field Commander action, the character may affect allies equal to twice his Presence. In addition, he may spend :tri: generated on his Leadership checks to allow one ally to suffer one strain to perform an action, rather than a maneuver.
Whenever a character reduces the amount of strain a starship or vehicle suffers, he reduces one additional strain per rank of Fine Tuning.

Description: Remove up to :bk: :bk: from skill checks to find food, water, or shelter. Survival checks to forage take half the time.
LongDescription: Remove up to :bk: :bk: from skill checks to find food, water, or shelter. Survival checks to forage take half the time.

Description: Gain +1 Force Rating.
LongDescription: Each rank permanently increases Force rating by one.

When making a Melee or Brawl combat check, the character may suffer a number of strain, then upgrade the ability of his combat check by that number. The number cannot exceed his ranks in Frenzied Attack.

The character may push a ship or vehicle past its limits of speed. He may perform the Full Throttle action, attempting a Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) Piloting check With success, the ship's top speed increases by one for a number of rounds equal to Cunning. The ship still cannot perform actions or maneuvers it could not perform normally (i.e. actions that have a minimum speed requirement).
The character may voluntarily suffer one strain to attempt Full Throttle as a maneuver. In addition, the difficulty of Full Throttle is reduced to Average (:pu: :pu:)
When the character successfully performs Full Throttle, the ship's top speed increases by two for a number of rounds equal to his Cunning, instead of one.
Remove :bk: per rank of Galaxy Mapper from all Astrogation checks. In addition, Astrogation checks take 50% less time. This does not increase with multiple ranks of Galaxy Mapper.

Description: Remove :bk: per rank of Gearhead from Meehanics checks. Halve the credit cost to add mods to attachments.
LongDescription: Remove :bk: per rank of Gearhead from all Mechanics checks. In addition, the credit cost to add mods to attachments decreases by 50% . This does not increase with multiple ranks of Gearhead.

Description: Gain +1 Strain Threshold.
LongDescription: Each rank of Grit increases a character's strain threshold by one.

The character may perform the Hard Headed action. On any turn in which the character is staggered or disoriented, he may perform the Hard Headed action (this action may be specifically performed even though he is normally barred from performing actions when staggered). He makes a Daunting (:pu: :pu: :pu: :pu:) Discipline check If he succeeds, he is no longer staggered or disoriented. The difficulty of this check decreases by one per additional rank of Hard Headed, to a minimum of Easy (:pu:)

The character may use his Hard Headed action to recover from being incapacitated due to exceeding his strain threshold. On his next turn after being incapacitated, he may make a Formidable(:pu: :pu: :pu: :pu: :pu:) Discipline check as his Hard Headed action (this action can specifically be performed even though he is normally barred from performing actions). If he succeeds, decrease his strain to one below his strain threshold. The difficulty of this check decreases by one per rank of Hard Headed, to a minimum of Easy (:pu:).

Description: Allies within short range add :bl: to Perception or Vigilance checks. Engaged allies add :bl: :bl:.
LongDescription: Allies within close range of the character add :bl: to their Perception and Vigilance checks. Allies engaged with him add :bl: :bl: instead.

The character may spend one Destiny Point to ignore the effects of ongoing Critical Injuries on any Brawn or Agility related checks until the end of the encounter. He still suffers from the injury itself.

Any large equipment, vehicle, or droid that the character owns has one or more hidden compartments for smuggling appropriately sized gear. The number of compartments is up to the player, but cannot be enough to hold a total encumbrance value of items more than the character's ranks in Hidden Storage. The size of the compartments are proportional to the size of the vehicle or droid in question. Most humanoid droids can only hold items equivalent in size to a one-handed weapon, whereas a silhouette 4 starship could conceal humanoids within its compartments. Any checks to detect these compartments have a Formidable ( :pu: :pu: :pu: :pu: :pu: ) difficulty.

The character may spend one Destiny Point to make a Hold Together incidental immediately after a vehicle or starship he has repaired this encounter takes damage. The character explains why the apparently serious damage was in fact superficial, and the damage from the attack becomes system strain instead.

The character adds :bl: per rank of Hunter to all skill checks when interacting with wild beasts and animals, including combat checks. Add +10 per rank to all Critical Injury rolls against animals per rank of Hunter.

The character's appearance is so common that people have a hard time identifying distinguishing traits. Opposing characters upgrade the difficulty of any checks made to identify him once per rank of Indistinguishable.
Perception and Discipline become career skills if they are not already.

The character may take the Inspiring Rhetoric action: making an Average (:pu: :pu:) Leadership check. For each :suc:, one ally within close range recovers one strain. For each :adv:, one ally benefiting from Inspiring Rhetoric recovers one additional strain.
Each ally affected by Inspiring Rhetoric gains :bl: on all skill checks for a number of rounds equal to the character's ranks in Leadership; this does not stack with itself.
The character may voluntarily suffer 1 strain to perform Inspiring Rhetoric as a maneuver instead of an action.
Before making a skill check, the character may perform the Intense Focus maneuver. The character suffers one strain to upgrade the ability of the skill check once.

Description: Spend 1 Destiny Point to recover strain equal to Presence rating.
LongDescription: The character may spend one Destiny Point to recover strain equal to his Presence rating.

Description: May suffer a number of strain to downgrade difficulty of Coercion checks, or upgrade the difficulty when targeted by Coercion checks, by an equal number. Strain suffered this way cannot exceed ranks in Intimidating.
LongDescription: When attempting a Coercion check, the character may suffer a number of strain to downgrade the difficulty of the check a number of times equal to the strain suffered. This number cannot exceed his ranks in Intimidating. When the character is the target of a Coercion check, the character may suffer a number of strain to upgrade the difficulty of the check a number of times equal to the strain suffered. This number cannot exceed his ranks in Intimidating.

Description: When constructing new items or modifying attachments, add :bl: or remove :bk: per rank of lnventor.
LongDescription: When constructing new items or modifying existing attachments (see Chapter V: Gear and Equipment), the character may choose to add :bl:  or remove :bk: from the check per rank of Inventor.

Description: Once per round, may stand from seated or prone as an incidental.
LongDescription: Once per round on the character's turn, the character may stand up from prone or a seated position as an Incidental.

Description: Choose 1 weapon, armor, or other item and give it a permanent improvement while it remains in use.
LongDescription: The character chooses one personal weapon or piece of armor per rank of Jury Rigged. He may increase the damage of the weapon by one; decrease the Advantage cost on its Critical, or any single other effect by one to a minimum of one; or increase armor's ranged or melee defense by one. Alternatively, he can decrease the encumbrance of the item by two to a minimum of one. The bonus only applies so long as the character is using the item. If the item is ever lost or destroyed, the character may apply Jury Rigged to a new personal weapon or piece or armor.

Description: Remove :bk: per rank of Kill With Kindness from all Charm and Leadership checks.
LongDescription: Remove :bk: per rank of Kill with Kindness from all Charm and Leadership checks the character attempts.

After hitting with a melee attack, the character may knock the target prone by spending a :tri: . If the target is larger than the acting character, it requires one additional :tri: for each silhouette larger.

Description: Once per session, when attempting to purchase a legally available item, reduce its rarity by 1 per rank of Know Somebody.
LongDescription: Once per game session, when attempting to purchase a legally available item, the character may reduce its rarity by one step per rank of Know Somebody.

Description: When acquired, choose Knowledge skill. When making that skill check, may spend :tri: result to gain additional successes equal to ranks in Knowledge Specialization.
LongDescription: When the character first acquires this talent, he may choose one Knowledge skill. When making checks with that skill, he may spend:tri: to gain additional successes equal to his ranks in Knowledge Specialization.

Once per game session, the character may spend a maneuver to make a Hard ( :pu: :pu: :pu: ) Knowledge (Education) check. Success means the character is familiar with a building or capital ship's design. He now knows the location of critical components or facilities within the ship or vehicle, as well as his own location. He can also plan unconventional routes around obstacles. Additional :suc:, :adv:, or :tri: results can reveal other useful information at the GM's discretion.

Description: Add +10 per rank of Lethal Blows to any Critical Injury results inflicted on opponents.
LongDescription: The character adds + 10 per rank of Lethal Blows to any Critical Injury rolls inflicted on opponents.

Once per round on the character's turn, the character may mount or dismount from a vehicle or beast, or slide into the cockpit or weapon station aboard a starship, as an incidental instead of a maneuver.
Once per round, the character may suffer two strain to decrease the difficulty of his next Medicine check by one to a minimum of Easy (:pu:).

Before making a check when buying or selling items, or undertaking or paying off Obligation, the character may choose to suffer two strain. If the check succeeds, he sells the item for 25% more than base cost, buys it for 25% less, pays off an additional one Obligation point, or undertakes one less Obligation point.

Description: Once per round, suffer 2 strain to decrease the difficulty of next Stealth or Skulduggery check by one.
LongDescription: Once per round, the character may voluntarily suffer two strain to decrease the difficulty of the next Stealth or Skulduggery check by one, to a minimum of Easy (:pu:)
Once per round when piloting a starship (a ship piloted using the Piloting (Space) skill), the character may voluntarily suffer two strain to perform any action as a maneuver instead.

Once per round, the character may perform a Master Slicer incidental to suffer two strain and decrease the difficulty of the next Computers or other slicing-related check by one, to a minimum of Easy (:pu:).
Once per round, the character may suffer two strain to decrease the difficulty of his next Astrogation check by one, to a minimum of Easy (:pu:).

The character may spend one Destiny Point to ignore the effects of ongoing Critical Injuries on any Intellect or Cunning related checks until the end of the encounter. He still suffers from the injury itself.
Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Brawl or Melee check.

Description: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Charm or Deception check.
LongDescription: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Charm or Deception check.

Description: Once per session, may reroll any 1 Medicine check.
LongDescription: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Medicine check.

Description: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Coercion or Streetwise check.
LongDescription: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Coercion or Streetwise check.
Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Perception or Vigilance check.
Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Ranged (Light) or Ranged (Heavy) check.

Description: Once per session, may reroll any 1 Cool or Negotiation check.
LongDescription: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Cool or Negotiation check.
Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Resilience or Survival check.
Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Piloting (Space) or Gunnery check.
Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Computers or Astrogation check.
Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Skulduggery or Stealth check.
Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Knowledge skill check.
Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Mechanics check.

Description: Upgrade difficulty of incoming Charm, Coercion, and Deception checks once per rank of Nobody's Fool.
LongDescription: The difficulty of any Charm, Coercion, or Deception checks attempted against the character is upgraded once for each rank of Nobody's Fool.

The character removes :bk: per rank of Outdoorsman from checks to move through terrain or manage terrain or environmental effects. Decrease overland travel times by 50% (this does not decrease with multiple ranks of Outdoorsman).

When the character performs a Charm, Coercion, or Deception check, he may include :wh: equal to his Force rating. Each :lsp: adds :suc: to Charm checks. Each :dsp: adds :suc: to Coercion or Deception checks. However, every :lsp: :lsp: add :fai: to Coercion or Deception checks, and every :dsp: :dsp: add :fai: to Charm checks. This does not apply to targets immune to Force powers.

Description: Remove :bk: per rank of Plausible Deniability frrom Coercion and Deception check.
LongDescription: Remove :bk: per rank of Plausible Deniability from all Coercion and Deception checks the character attempts.

Description: Add 1 damage per rank of Point Blank to damage of one hit of successful attack while using Ranged (Heavy) or Ranged (Light) skills at close range or engaged.
LongDescription: The character adds one damage per rank of Point Blank to one hit of successful Ranged (Heavy) or Ranged (Light) attacks made while at short range or engaged.

Description: Once per round, may perform Precise Aim maneuver. Suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks in Precise Aim, then reduce target's melee and ranged defense by that number.
LongDescription: Once per round on the character's turn, the character may perform a Precise Aim maneuver before attempting a combat check and suffer a number of strain. The number of strain cannot exceed his ranks in Precise Aim. He then decreases the target's defense (ranged and melee) by one per strain suffered for that combat check.

When making a Brawl check against a living opponent, the character may choose to forgo dealing damage as wounds, instead dealing the equivalent damage as strain, plus additional strain equal to his ranks in Medicine. These checks cannot be made with any weapons, but this strain damage is not reduced by soak.

Description: Once per round, draw or holster a weapon or accessible item as an incidental.
LongDescription: Once per round on the character's turn, he may draw or holster an easily accessible weapon as an incidental, not a maneuver. This talent also reduces the amount of time to draw or stow a weapon that usually requires more than one maneuver to properly prepare or stow, by one maneuver.

Description: Add :bl: per rank of Quick Strike to combat checks against targets that have not acted yet this encounter.
LongDescription: When performing a combat check during combat, the character adds • per rank of Quick Strike to combat checks against any target that has not yet acted in the encounter.

Description: Suffer a number of strain to add an equal number of :suc: to lnitiative checks. Strain suffered cannot exceed ranks in Rapid Reacuon.
LongDescription: The character may suffer a number of strain to add an equal number of & to any Vigilance or Cool check to determine initiative order. The number may not exceed his ranks in Rapid Reaction.

Description: When healing strain after an encounter, heal 1 additional strain per rank of Rapid Recovery.
LongDescription: When this character heals strain after an encounter has concluded, he heals one additional strain per rank in Rapid Recovery.

With an Easy (:pu:) Mechanics check, the character may harvest components from a functioning device to repair a broken one, without breaking the functioning device. This allows the character to repair a broken device without having required spare parts, raw materials, or repair kits (the initial check does not suffer penalties for lacking repair kits, either). This only works, however, if the functioning device is at least the same size and technological level as the device being repaired (it is impossible to repair a starship with a blaster pistol, or a lightsaber with parts from a water wheel).

Description: Remove :bk: per rank of Researcher from all knowledge checks. Researching a subject Lakes half the time.
LongDescription: The character removes :bk: per rank of Researcher from all Knowledge checks. Researching takes 50% less time (this does not increase with multiple ranks of researcher).
When the character suffers strain, he suffers one less strain per rank of Resolve, to a minimum of one. This does not apply to voluntary strain loss.
The character downgrades the difficulty of checks to interact with institutions of learning equal to his ranks in Respected Scholar.

Description: Take a Scathing Tirade action: make an Average (:pu: :pu:) Coercion check. Each :suc: causes one enemy in shore range to suffer 1 strain. Spend :adv: to cause 1 affected enemy to suffer 1 additional strain.
LongDescription: The character may take the Scathing Tirade action; making an Average (:pu: :pu:) Coercion check. For each :suc:, one enemy within short range suffers one strain. The character can also spend :adv:; for every :adv: spent, one target already affected suffers 1 additional strain.
Each enemy affected by Scathing Tirade suffers :bk: on all skill checks for a number of rounds equal to the character's ranks in Coercion; this does not stack with itself.
The character may voluntarily suffer one strain to perform Scathing Tirade as a maneuver instead of an action.

Description: Once per encounter, may use Second Wind incidental to recover strain equal to ranks in Second Wind.
LongDescription: Once per encounter, the character may use a Second Wind incidental to recover an amount of strain equal to his ranks in Second Wind.

Description: Once per session, remove :bk: :bk: from any 1 check.
LongDescription: Once per game session, the character may remove :bk: :bk: from any one skill check.

Description: Add :bl: to all Charm, Coercion and Deception checks unless the target is immune to Force powers.
LongDescription: The character adds :bl: to all Charm, Coercion, and Deception checks unless the target is immune to Force Powers.
During a chase, the character adds :bl: equal to his ranks in Shortcut to any checks made to catch or escape an opponent.

Once per round on the character's turn, the character may perform a Side Step maneuver to side step and try to avoid incoming ranged attacks. He then suffers a number of strain no greater than his ranks in Side Step. Until the start of the character's next turn, upgrade the difficulty of all ranged combat checks targeting the character a number of times equal to the strain suffered by the character.
The character gains + 1 ranged defense.
The character removes :bk: per rank of Skilled Jockey from all Piloting (Planetary) and Piloting (Space) checks the character attempts.
When making a Computers check, the character may spend :tri: to gain some measure of control over the target system. Any further Computers checks within this system can be made as maneuvers.

Description: When first acquired, choose 1 skill: Charm, Coercion, Deception or Negotiation. When making checks with that skill, spend :tri: to gain additional :suc: equal to ranks in Smooth Talker.
LongDescription: When a character acquires this talent, he chooses one skill: Charm, Coercion, Negotiation, or Deception. When making checks with that skill, he may spend :tri: to gain additional :suc: equal to his ranks in Smooth Talker.

Description: Before making a non-thrown ranged attack, may perform a Sniper Shot maneuver to increase the weapon's range by 1 range band per rank in Sniper Shot. Upgrade the difficulty of the attack by 1 per range band increase.
LongDescription: Once per round before making a non-thrown ranged attack, the character may perform a maneuver to attempt a Sniper Shot. Sniper Shot increases the maximum range of his ranged weapon up to one range band per rank. For each rank beyond the normal maximum of the weapon, upgrade the difficulty of the check by one (this is in addition to the increased difficulty of the shot due to longer range).
After making a successful attack with a non-starship/ vehicle weapon, the character may spend one Destiny Point to add damage equal to his Cunning to one hit of the successful attack.
The character repairs + 1 hull trauma per rank of Solid Repairs whenever he repairs a vehicle or starship.

Description: Cannot run out of ammo due to :des:. Items with Limited Ammo quality run out of ammo as normal.
LongDescription: The character does not run out of ammo on a :des: . Items with Limited Ammo quality run out of ammo as normal.
The character grants :bl: per rank of Speaks Binary to any tasks he directs a nonplayer droid to perform.

Description: Add :bl: per rank of Stalker to all Stealth and Coordination checks.
LongDescription: The character adds :bl: per rank of Stalker to all Coordination and Stealth checks.

Description: Spend 1 Destiny Point to ignore effects of Critical Injuries on Willpower or Presence checks until the end of the encounter.
LongDescription: The character may spend one Destiny Point to ignore the effects of ongoing Critical Injuries on any Presence or Willpower related checks until the end of the encounter. He still suffers from the injury itself.

The character may take the Stim Application action. To perform this action, he must have access to drugs, a medpac, or stimpacks. He makes a Average (:pu: :pu:) Medicine check. If successful, one ally he is engaged with (including himself) increases one characteristic of the character's choice by one for the remainder of the encounter, and suffers four strain. A single character's individual characteristics may each only be increased once by Stim Application during an encounter.

As an incidental, when performing the Stim Application action, the character may increase the difficulty of the Medicine check to Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) as an incidental. If he does so, the target of the action suffers one strain instead of four.
When performing the Stim Application action, each :tri: may be spent to increase an additional characteristic by one.
Remove :bk: per rank of Street Smarts from any Streetwise or Knowledge (Underworld) checks the character attempts.

Once per game session, the character can choose to make one skill check using Intellect, rather than the characteristic linked to that skill. When he does this, he must explain how, in this particular instance, his intelligence is helping him overcome this challenge.

Description: When making Melee checks, may inflict damage as strain instead of wounds. This does not ignore soak.
LongDescription: When making Melee checks, the character may choose to deal damage as strain instead of wounds. This does not ignore soak.

Description: When dealing strain damage with Melee or Brawl checks, may spend :tri: to stagger target for 1 round per :tri:.
LongDescription: When dealing strain damage with Melee or Brawl checks, the character may spend a :tri: result to stagger his target (see page 218) for one round per :tri: spent.
The character gains + 1 melee defense

Description: When making a Medicine check to help a character heal wounds, the target heals I addilional wound per rank of Surgeon.
LongDescription: When this character makes a Medicine check to help a character heal wounds, the target heals one additional wound per rank of Surgeon.

Description: Do not suffer usual penalties for moving through difficult terrain.
LongDescription: The character does not suffer the penalties for moving through difficult terrain (he moves through it at normal speed, without spending additional maneuvers).

Description: After making a successful attack, may spend 1 Destiny Point to add damage equal to Agility to one hit.
LongDescription: On a successful attack during combat with a non-starship/ vehicle weapon, the character may spend one Destiny Point to add damage equal to his Agility to one hit of the successful attack.
For each rank, the character reduces the amount of time needed to complete Computer-related tasks by 25%.

Description: May add 1 additional hard point to a number of items equal to ranks in Tinkerer. Each item may only be modified once.
LongDescription: The character makes one piece of equipment more modifiable. He chooses one piece of equipment and increases its number of hard points by one. He can only do this once per piece of equipment, but can modify a number of pieces of equipment equal to his ranks in Tinkerer. If he loses a modified piece of equipment, he may apply Tinkerer to a new one.
Once per game session, the character may add :bl: :bl: to any one skill check.

Description: Gain +2 wound threshold.
LongDescription: The character increases his wound threshold by two per rank of Toughened.
Any vehicle the character pilots counts as having a silhouette one lower than normal when being attacked, to a minimum of 0.

Description: Add :bl: per rank of Uncanny Reactions to all Vigilance checks.
LongDescription: The character adds :bl: per rank of Uncanny Reactions to all Vigilance checks.

Description: Add :bl: per ranks of Uncanny Senses to all Perception checks.
LongDescription: The character adds :bl: per rank of Uncanny Senses to all Perception checks.

The character may spend one Destiny Point to perform a Utility Belt incidental to produce a previously undocumented—but essential—small tool from his utility belt, satchel, or pockets, with a rarity no greater than (4). This cannot be a weapon unless the weapon has the Limited Ammo 1 quality.

The character removes :bk: equal to the character's ranks in Utinni! from checks made to find or scavenge items or gear. These checks could include Negotiation, Perception, or other checks, depending on circumstances  and the GM's discretion. Such skill checks take half their normal time (this does not decrease with multiple ranks of Utinni!).
The character chooses any two skills. They permanently become career skills.
When he sells legal goods to a reputable merchant or business, the character gains an additional 10% more credits per rank of Wheel and Deal (based on the original sell price of the good or item).

Once per session, if the character is incapacitated due to exceeding his wound threshold, he may perform the Against All Odds action (this action may be performed even though characters are normally barred from performing actions when incapacitated). The character makes a Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) Resilience check, rolling a number of :wh: equal to his Force rating as part of the check. If successful, the character heals wounds equal to :suc:. The character may spend Force points :ldsp: to add :suc: to the result.

Through the Force, the character with which he is currently interacting. This cannot be done during structured encounters. This animal must have a silhouette equal to or smaller than half the character's Force rating when the bond is created, rounded down (this means a character with Force rating 1 could only bond with a silhouette 0 animal). The bond persists as long as the character chooses it to, although at the GM's discretion, the bond may also be broken due to abusive treatment or other extenuating circumstances. 

As long as the bond persists. the animal remains near the character, and the controlling player dictates the animal's overall behavior (although, since the animal is only bonded with the character, not dominated, it may still perform certain inconvenient actions such as scratching furniture, consuming rations, and marking territory). Once per round in structured encounters, the character may spend one maneuver to direct his animal in performing one action and one maneuver. The animal must be within hearing and visual range of the character (generally medium range) to do this. Otherwise, the animal does not contribute to the encounter. The specifics of its behavior are up to the player and GM.

When making checks to handle, tame, or control animals, the character may add a number of :wh: no greater than his Force rating to the check. The character may spend :ldsp: to add :suc: or :adv: (character's choice) to the result.
When making a Lightsaber skill check, the character may use Agility instead of Brawn.

Description: Once per session, when an ally protected by the Body Guard maneuver suffers a hit, suffer the hit instead.
LongDescription: Once per round on the character's turn, the character may perform a Body Guard maneuver to protect one ally with whom he is engaged. He then suffers a number of strain no greater than his ranks in Body Guard. Until the start of the character's next turn, upgrade the difficulty of all combat checks targeting the protected ally a number of times equal to the strain suffered by the character.

Description: When an opponent targets character with a Force povver. Reduce :ldsp: generated by 1.
LongDescription: When an opponent targets the character with a Force power. after the opponent generates O . reduce the total O generated by one, to a minimum of 0.

Description: Spend a maneuver and suffer 2 strain to extend Calming Aura's effects to allies equal to Willpovver at short range until start of next turn.
LongDescription: The character may spend a maneuver and suffer 2 strain to extend the effects of Calming Aura to a number of allies within short range equal to his Willpower. This lasts until the beginning of his next turn.

Description: Take a Center of Being maneuver. Until the beginning of next turn, attacks against the character increase their crilical rating by 1 per rank of Center of Being.
LongDescription: Once per round, when wielding a lightsaber, the character can make a Center of Being maneuver. Until the beginning of his next turn, whenever an enemy makes a melee attack targeting the character. the critical rating of the enemy's weapon counts as one higher per rank of Center of Being.

Description: Suffer 1 strain to perform Center of Being maneuver as an Incidental.
LongDescription: The character may voluntarily suffer 1 strain to perform Center of Being as an incidental instead of a maneuver.

Description: When an engaged ally surfers a hit. may use Parry or Reflect incidental against the hit.
LongDescription: When an ally engaged with the character suffers a hit from a combat check, the character may use a Parry or Reflect incidental to reduce the damage the hit deals (even though he is not the target of the combat check).

Description: Take Comprehend Technology action; make an Average (:pu: :pu:) Knowledge (Education) check to use Force rating as ranks in skills to use single item.
LongDescription:
Once per session. the character may take the Comprehend Technology action. making an Average (:pu: :pu:) Knowledge (Education) check to intuitively understand one weapon. armor set. or other piece of personal gear. Success means that for the remainder of the encounter, when the character makes any skill checks to use or repair the item, he may count his ranks in The applicable skill as equal to his current Force rating. 

For example, a character may use Comprel1end Technology to count his ranks in Mechanics as equal to his Force rating when repairing a broken lightsaber, or he can count his ranks in Ranged (Light) as equal to his Force rating when firing a blaster pistol.
The character removes :bk: per rank of Conditioned from his Athletics and Coordination checks. He reduces the damage and strain suffered from falling by 1 per rank of Coordination.

Description: Spend 1 Destiny Point to recover strain equal to Cunning rating.
LongDescription: The character may spend one Destiny Point to recover strain equal Lo his Cunning rating.
Whenever an attack misses the character, the character may spend :thr: :thr: or :des: to upgrade the next Lightsaber (Cunning) combat check he makes against the attacker during his next turn once.

Description: May take the Defensive Circle action. making a Hard(:pu: :pu: :pu:) Lightsaber (Intellect) check. The character, plus one ally within short range per :suc: gains X defense until the beginning of next turn. X equals 1 plus 1 per :adv: :adv:.
LongDescription: While wielding a lightsaber. the character may take the Defensive Circle action. making a Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) Lightsaber (Intellect) check. If successful. the character plus one ally per :suc: within short range gains ranged and melee defense X until the beginning of the character's next turn. X equals 1, plus 1 for every :adv: :adv:.

Description: When wielding a Lightsaber, Melee, or Brawl weapon. the weapon gains the Defensive quality with a rating equal to ranks in Defensive Training.
LongDescription: When the character wields a Lightsaber weapon, Melee weapon, or Brawl weapon, that weapon gains ranks in the Defensive item quality equal to the character's ranks in Defensive Training (this replaces any ranks in Defensive the weapon already has).

The character may take a Disruptive Strike action. making a Lightsaber (Cunning) combat check against one engaged target and adding :wh: no greater than Force rating to the check. The character may spend :ldsp: to add :fai: to the target's next combat check made during this encounter.

After using the Reflect incidental. The character may spend one Destiny Point to perform a Move maneuver as an out of turn incidental to move closer to or engage an opponent. This incidental may be performed once per round.

Description: Perform Draw Closer action: make a Lightsaber (Willpower) combat check against one silhouette 1 target within medium range, adding :wh: no greater than Force rating to check. Spend :ldsp: to move target one range band closer or to add :suc: to check.
LongDescription: The character may take a Draw Closer action. making a Lightsaber (Willpower) melee combat check against one silhouette 1 (or smaller) target within medium range and adding a number of :wh: no greater than Force rating to the check. The character may spend :ldsp: before resolving the success or failure of the check to move the target one range band closer to the character (including from short to engaged). He may also spend :ldsp: to add :suc: to the combat check. If the character cannot move his target to engage him. the combat check automatically misses.

Description: Add :bl: to Melee and Lightsaber checks when engaged with only one opponent.
LongDescription: The character adds :bl: to his Melee and Lightsaber checks when engaged with only a single opponent. A single minion group counts as multiple opponents.

Description: When making a Leadership check. add :wh: no greater than Force rating. Spend :ldsp: to add :suc: or :adv: to the resuIt.
LongDescription: When making a Leadership check, the character may add :wh: no greater than Force rating to the check. The character may spend :ldsp: to add :suc: or :adv: (character's choice) to the result.

Description: Suffer 2 strain to add damage equal to Brawn to next Lightsaber combat check made this turn.
LongDescription: Once per round the character may suffer 2 strain to add additional damage equal to Brawn to one hit of a successful Lightsaber combat check.

Description: When an adversary becomes engaged with the character, the character may force the adversary to make a fear check, with the difficulty equal to the character's ranks in Fearsome.
LongDescription: When an adversary becomes engaged with the character, the character may force the adversary to make a fear check (see page 326), with the difficulty equal to the character's ranks in Fearsome. At the GM's discretion, some adversaries may be immune to this talent based on the type of adversary or the ongoing circumstances.

Description: Spend :tri: or :adv: :adv: :adv: generated on a missed melee attack to upgrade difficulty of opponent's next altack targeting character by ranks in Feint.
LongDescription: Upon missing an opponent with a Lightsaber, Brawl, or Melee combat check. the character may spend :tri: or :adv: :adv: :adv: to upgrade the difficulty of the opponent's next combat check targeting the character during this encounter by the character's ranks in Feint.

Description: Spend :tri: or :adv: :adv: :adv: on a missed Lightsaber (Willpower) combat check to immediately perform Move Force power action as maneuver.
LongDescription:
Upon missing an opponent with a Lightsaber (Willpower) combat check, the character may spend :tri: or :adv: :adv: :adv: to perform a Move Force power action as a maneuver this turn (the character must still be able to perform maneuvers and still may not perform more than two maneuvers in a turn). 

The character must have already purchased the Move Force power to use it as part of this ability.

Description: Perform the Force Protection maneuver: suffer 1 strain and commit :wh: up to ranks of Force Protection. Increase soak by number of :wh: committed until beginning of next turn. Suffer 1 strain every turn :wh: remains committed.
LongDescription: The character may take the Force Protection maneuver, suffering 1 strain and committing a number of :wh: no greater than Force rating or ranks of Force Protection. The character then increases his soak value by an equal amount. The character suffers 1 strain at the beginning of each of his turns in which he keeps these dice committed.

Description: Perform the Forewarning action. All allies within medium range increase defense by character's Force rating until they act in the encounter.
LongDescription: The character may take the Forewarning action. All allies within medium range increase their melee and ranged defense by a number equal to the character's Force rating until they take their first turn during an encounter. If they have already taken their first turn, Forewarning has no effect.

The character may take a Hawk Bat Swoop action, performing a Lightsaber (Agility) melee combat check against one target within short range and adding :wh: no greater than Force rating to the pool. The character may spend :ldsp: before resolving the success or failure of the check to engage the target immediately as an incidental, and may spend :ldsp: to add :adv: to the check. If the character cannot move to engage the target, the attack automatically misses.

Description: Commit :wh:. For every full encounLer :wh: remains committed. Heal 1 wound per rank or Healing Trance.
LongDescription: The character may commit :wh:. For every full encounter :wh: remains committed, the character heals 1 wound he is suffering per rank of Healing Trance. This is in addition to wounds healed due to natural rest or other abilities. If in a situation without defined encounters, the GM can have Healing Trance take effect every 12 hours.

Description: When healing wounds due to Healing Trance, make a Resilience check to heal a Critical Injury. Difficulty of the check equals severity of the Critical Injury.
LongDescription: Whenever the character heals wounds as a result of Healing Trance, if the character is suffering from a Critical Injury, he makes a Resilience check with the difficulty equal to the Critical Injury's severity rating. On a successful check, the character recovers from the Critical Injury. If the character is suffering from multiple Critical Injuries, he chooses which one to attempt to recover from.

Description: Take the Imbue Item maneuver; suffer 1 strain and commit :wh: to grant one weapon, piece of armor, or item an improvement while :wh: remains committed. Suffer 1 strain every round :wh: remains committed.
LongDescription: The character may take the Imbue Item maneuver, suffering 1 strain and committing :wh:. He then grants one weapon or item within short range a temporary enhancement chosen from the following options: increase weapon's damage by 1, decrease the :adv: cost for its Critical Hit or for any other single effect by 1, to a minimum of 1, or increase a piece of armor's ranged or melee defense by 1 . Alternatively, the character can decrease an item's encumbrance by 2 to a minimum of 1. The character suffers 1 strain at the beginning of each of his turns in which he keeps this die committed.

When piloting a vehicle of silhouette 5 or smaller, the character may take the Intuitive Evasion maneuver, suffering l strain and committing a number of :wh: no greater than his Force rating or his ranks of Intuitive Evasion. He then upgrades the difficulty of combat checks targeting his vehicle by an equal amount. The character suffers 1 strain at the beginning of each of his turns in which these dice remain committed.

When making a check to repair or craft a non-starship or vehicle item, the character may add :wh: no greater than Force rating to the check. The character may spend :ldsp: :ldsp: to permanently increase the number of hard points the item has by 1. to a maximum of 2 additional hard points. An item may only be improved in this way once.

When making a Ranged (Heavy) or Ranged (Light) combat check, the character may add :wh: no greater than Force rating to the check. The character may spend :ldsp: to add :suc: or :adv: (character's choice) to the result.

When making a combat check with a vehicle weapon, the character may add :wh: no greater than Force rating to the check. The character may spend :ldsp: :ldsp: to add :suc: or :adv: (character's choice) to the result.

Description: Remove :bk: per rank of Keen Eyed from Perception and Vigilance checks. Decrease time to search a specific area by half.
LongDescription: The character removes :bk: per rank of Keen Eyed from his Perception and Vigilance checks. Checks made to search a specific area take 50% less time than normal. This does not decrease with additional ranks of Keen Eyed.

Description: Once per session. When making a check, count Force rating as being equal to ranks in Knowledge (Lore).
LongDescription: Once per session, when making a single check, the character may treat his Force rating as being equal to his ranks in Knowledge (Lore).

Description: When healing an ally, spend 1 Destiny Point t o heal additional wounds equal to ranks in Knovvledge (Xenology).
LongDescription: When the character performs a successful Medicine check to heal an ally, the character may spend one Destiny Point to allow The target to heal additional wounds equal to the character's ranks in Knowledge (Xenology).

Description: Take the Makashi Finish action. Perform a Lightsaber (Presence) combat check against engaged target. adding :wh: no greater than Force rating. Spend :ldsp: to add +10 to any resulting Critical Injury rolls.
LongDescription: The character may take the Makashi Finish action, making a Lightsaber (Presence) combat check against an engaged target, adding :wh: no greater than Force rating to the check. The character may spend :ldsp: to add +10 to any Critical Injury roll resulting from the check.

Description: Once per encounter. Perrorm Makashi Flourish action. Make an Average (:pu: :pu:) Lightsaber (Presence) check. 1 engaged opponent suffers strain equal to :suc:, and heal an equal amount of strain.
LongDescription: Once per encounter, the character may take the Makashi Flourish action, making an Average (:pu: :pu:) Lightsaber (Presence) check. If it is successful, one engaged opponent suffers strain equal to :suc: (ignoring soak). and the character recovers an equal amount of strain. The character may also spend :adv: :adv:, or :tri: generated on the check to stagger the opponent until the end of the target's next turn.

Description: When making a check using the Lightsaber skill. The character may use Presence instead of Brawn.
LongDescription: When making a check using the Lightsaber skill, the character may use Presence instead of Brawn.
Once per round. the character may voluntarily suffer 2 strain to decrease the difficulty of his next Mechanics check (or his next check to build or mod an item) by one, to a minimum of Easy (:pu:).

The character may take the Mental Bond action, committing :wh:. As long as :wh: remains committed, he may communicate mentally with an animal bonded to him via the Animal Bond talent. He can see and hear what it sees and hears, and in structured encounters, he may direct his animal (see the Animal Bond talent, page 1 38) at up to extreme range.

Description: Always count as havng the right tools for the job when performing Mechanics checks .
LongDescription: The character always counts as having the right tools for the job (see page 181) when performing Mechanics checks.
The character adds :bl: to his Brawl, Melee, and Lightsaber combat checks when engaged with multiple opponents. This includes single groups of multiple minions.
Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Lightsaber or Melee check.

Description: Once per session, may reroll any 1 Force power check.
LongDescription: Once per session, the character may reroll any one Force power check.

Description: When making a Lightsaber skill check, the character may use Willpower instead of Bravvn.
LongDescription: When making a Lightsaber skill check, the character may use Willpower instead of Brawn.

Once per session, the character may take the Now You See Me action, making a Hard(:pu: :pu: :pu:) Deception check. If successful, a number of NPCs equal to his Cunning within medium range forget any interactions they had with the character during the last thirty minutes.

At the GM's discretion, multiple :thr: or :des: may give the NPCs in question unpleasant side effects, such as confusion, nightmares, or a persistent and maddening suspicion that they've forgotten something important.

Description: Once per session, meditate, then perform One with the Universe action: make Average (:pu: :pu:) Astrogation check. If successful, add :lsp: to all Force power checks in next encounter. If successful with :thr: add :dsp: instead.
LongDescription: Once per session, the character may spend several minutes meditating, then take the One with the Universe action, making an Average (:pu: :pu:) Astrogation check. If successful, during the next encounter he adds :lsp: to all Force power checks. However, if he succeeded with :thr:, he adds :dsp: to all Force power checks instead.

Description: When hit by a melee attack, suffer 3 strain to reduce damage by 2 plus ranks in Parry.
LongDescription: When the character suffers a hit from a Brawl, Melee, or Lightsaber combat check, after damage is calculated (but before soak is applied, so immediately after step 3 of Perform a Combat Check, page 210), the character may take a Parry incidental. He suffers 3 strain and reduces the damage dealt by that hit by a number equal to 2 plus his ranks in Parry. This talent may only be used once per hit and when the character is wielding a Lightsaber or Melee weapon.

Description: When parrying a hit that generated :des: or :thr: :thr: :thr:, may hit attacker once with Lightsaber, Brawl, or Melee weapon (dealing base damage) after original attack resolves.
LongDescription: When the character suffers a hit from a Brawl, Melee, or Lightsaber combat check and uses the Parry incidental to reduce the damage from that hit, after the attack is resolved, the character may spend :des: or :thr: :thr: :thr: to automatically hit the attacker once with a wielded Brawl, Melee, or Lightsaber weapon. This hit deals the weapon's base damage plus any damage from applicable talents or abilities. This talent may not be used if the original attack incapacitates the character.

Description: If the user did not make a combat check during his previous turn, may suffer 1 strain to use Parry.
LongDescription: If the user did not make a combat check during his previous turn, he suffers 1 strain when taking the Parry incidental, instead of 3.

Description: When making a Medicine check to help a character heal wounds, the target heals 1 additional strain per rank of Physician.
LongDescription: When this character makes a Medicine check to help a character heal wounds. the target heals one additional strain per rank of Physician.

Description: May spend 1 Destiny Point to disengage from engaged enemy as an out-of-turn incidental.
LongDescription: Immediately after an opponent moves to engage the character, the character may spend one Destiny Point to disengage from that opponent as an out-of-turn incidental.
The character deals + 1 damage to one hit on all successful combat checks against disoriented targets per rank of Prey on the Weak.

The ranged attack's hit must be one that is able to be reflected and redirected (generally only blaster weapons or other energy attacks fall into this category; anything else is subject to GM oversight). This talent may not be used if the original attack incapacitates the character.
If the character did not make a combat check during his previous turn, he suffers 1 strain when taking the Reflect incidental, instead of 3.

of the engagement (character's choice).
